case_vignette: A 7-YEAR-OLD HEALTHY BOY IS BROUGHT TO THE DERMATOLOGY CLINIC BY HIS PARENTS AFTER HAVING HAD A 3-WEEK HISTORY OF A RASH. THE PATIENT’S RASH WAS SLIGHTLY PRURITIC, AND IT INVOLVED PREDOMINANTLY THE TRUNK, STARTING AS ONE LARGER PINK PATCH WITH FINE SCALE AND SUBSEQUENTLY SPREADING WITH SMALLER SIMILAR MACULES AND PATCHES. THE BOY’S PALMS AND SOLES WERE SPARED OF THE RASH.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had a rash for about 3 weeks now that's a bit itchy, mostly on my trunk. It started with one large pink patch and then spread with smaller similar spots. My palms and soles don't have the rash.
Do you have any history of similar skin issues or other chronic illnesses?
No, I've been healthy with no other similar skin issues or chronic illnesses.
Have you used any new medications, lotions, or laundry detergents recently?
No, I haven't used any new medications, lotions, or laundry detergents recently.
Has anyone in your family had similar skin problems or been diagnosed with a skin condition?
No, no one in my family has had similar skin problems or been diagnosed with a skin condition.
Final Diagnosis: Pityriasis Rosea
